channel.title: Interfaces. Is this possible?
channel.description: I know you can do a lot with interfaces. but this, I don't know if you can, or how to at least. I'm making clickable buttons in my new tab interface. But the question is, can you make the buttons have a state? I mean, you click it once, and the button sprite switches to one that looks clicked in, and click again it goes back to a normal button

item.title: Interfaces. Is this possible?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“HcoJustin, post:6, topic:508130”]That is because the server is keeping track of the states, and toggling them as needed. If you look at the last 2 parameters for AddInterfaceButton, they are for the config used (170), and for the value required to enable it (1).

In the server when you click on button 25828, you will see that it toggles your mouse buttons and then sends back config 170 with the updated value.[/quote]
That’s so damn confusing to me
I’ll just go with buttons and change the text based on clicks.

Edit:
Scratch all that I said here before.
I just need the clicking button ID’s and I have no clue how to get them, as they don’t show up when I press em.

Read full topic

item.title: Interfaces. Is this possible?
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

That is because the server is keeping track of the states, and toggling them as needed. If you look at the last 2 parameters for AddInterfaceButton, they are for the config used (170), and for the value required to enable it (1).

In the server when you click on button 25828, you will see that it toggles your mouse buttons and then sends back config 170 with the updated value.

Read full topic

item.title: Interfaces. Is this possible?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

HcoJustin:

They just store the state in one of the configs

Huh?
I went through and found a few things inside of my client.
There’s like 3 addToggleButton methods, which I haven’t tried yet.
But what really confused me was that the buttons I have in my client that do toggle red and grey, are just normal interface buttons.
Example:

		AddInterfaceButton(25828, 4, 25829, 10, 9, "Interfaces/OptionTab/OPTION", 40, 40, "Toggle Mouse Buttons", 170, 1);
		drawTooltip(25829, "Toggle Mouse Buttons");

It’s normal state is grey, click it once it goes to red, click again, back to grey.

Read full topic

item.title: Interfaces. Is this possible?
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

They just store the state in one of the configs

Read full topic

item.title: Interfaces. Is this possible?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Ruby:

Yeah that’s possible, take a look at the settings tab on an older style client maybe a 377, you select an option and it changes to a red background but if you click it again it changes back to normal. I wouldn’t know how to do it, it is possible though.

I think my server has some red buttons exactly like that. Time to snoop.

I hate interfaces, yet I contiously make them

Read full topic
